item.value: TODO: checking logic and metric operation should be separated.
Not registered via @EnableConfigurationProperties, marked as Spring component, or scanned via @ConfigurationPropertiesScan
Publish rules to remote rule configuration center for given application name.

Returns a charset object for the named charset. Params: charsetName – The name of the requested charset; may be either a canonical name or an alias Returns: A charset object for the named charset Throws: IllegalCharsetNameException – If the given charset name is illegal IllegalArgumentException – If the given charsetName is null UnsupportedCharsetException – If no support for the named charset is available in this instance of the Java virtual machine
A read-only DataSource with Nacos backend. When the data in Nacos backend has been modified, Nacos will automatically push the new value so that the dynamic configuration can be real-time.
Load registered init functions and execute in order. Author: Eric Zhao
The web interceptor for privilege-based authorization. move from old AuthorizationInterceptor. Since: 1.7.1 Author: lkxiaolou, wxq

The blockHandler is located in the same class with the original method by default. However, if some methods share the same signature and intend to set the same block handler, then users can set the class where the block handler exists. Note that the block handler method must be static.
Returns: the entry type (inbound or outbound), outbound by default
The annotation indicates a definition of Sentinel resource
The annotation indicates a definition of Sentinel resource. Since: 0.1.1 Author: Eric Zhao, zhaoyuguang

This demo demonstrates how to use Nacos as the data source of Sentinel rules. Before you start, you need to start a Nacos server in local first, and then use NacosConfigSender to publish initial rule configuration to Nacos.
fill your namespace id,if you want to use namespace. for example: 0f5c7314-4983-4022-ad5a-347de1d1057d,you can get it on nacos's console

s demo demonstrates how to use Nacos as the data source of Sentinel rules. Before you start, you need to start a Nacos server in local first, and then use NacosConfigSender to publish initial rule configuration to Nacos.

This demo demonstrates how to use Nacos as the data source of Sentinel rules. Before you start, you need to start a Nacos server in local first, and then use NacosConfigSender to publish initial rule configuration to Nacos. Author: Eric Zhao
Single-thread pool. Once the thread pool is blocked, we throw up the old tas

A read-only DataSource with Nacos backend. When the data in Nacos backend has been modified, Nacos will automatically push the new value so that the dynamic configuration can be real-time. Author: Eric Zhao

Fetch real time statistics info of the machine. Params: ip – ip to fetch port – port of the ip type – one of [root, default, cluster], 'root' means fetching from tree root node, 'default' means fetching from tree default node, 'cluster' means fetching from cluster node. searchKey – key to search Returns: node statistics info.
